definition: individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general

sentences.english: Thieves and burglars nation and personal information still have personal privacy.
sentences.chinese: 盜竊國家和個人信息還有個人隱私。

sentences.english: Talking about wearing a bone, said Xie Xiaonuo belong to personal privacy.
sentences.chinese: 聊起戴骨順，謝小諾說屬於個人隱私。

sentences.english: Mr Snowden told the truth in the name of privacy.
sentences.chinese: 史諾頓以個人隱私的名義揭露真相。

sentences.english: But such private matters have a tendency to become public tragedies.
sentences.chinese: 但這樣的個人隱私正趨向於成爲社會的悲劇。

sentences.english: Goole today insisted there was no threat to privacy.
sentences.chinese: 古爾今天堅持，沒有威脅到個人隱私。

definition: abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to start rumours and create trouble
